primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in the hopeless cycle of human corruption and covenant-breaking by unilaterally establishing a New Covenant written on the heart.

tekstueel_bewijs: I will make a new covenant
I will put my law within them
I will write it upon their hearts
I will watch over them to build and to plant

object.identificatie: Redemption/New Covenant (The healing of the human heart)
tekstueel_bewijs: the plan and purpose of God to overcome the resistance of the human heart
the renewal of the world and the salvation of the human race

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Holy Spirit's Intention
tekstueel_bewijs: the shape of the book as we have it is part of the Holy Spirit’s intention

ontvanger.identificatie: The House of Israel / The Hearer (The Church)
tekstueel_bewijs: I will be their God, and they shall be my people
in his death on our behalf and in our place
this cup is the new covenant in my blood

tegenstander.identificatie: The Corrupt Human Heart / Sin / Death
tekstueel_bewijs: The heart is deceitful above all things, and desperately corrupt
In the midst of life we are in death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described as an 'incurable wound' and a 'stone wall' that renders human self-help impossible.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer, now transformed, lives as a sign of the New Covenant in a corrupt world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Christian / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Bearing fruit / Speaking up against evil
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly grounded in the primary program (soteriology): 'Because I am a creature of the New Covenant... I can say...'

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Cross → God ← The Deceitful Heart

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has written his commandments in my heart
The Lord is preparing to redeem his creation
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We surround ourselves with all sorts of defenses
We share in the human condition

voorbeelden: God is going to assess everyone according to his or her doings
He would never have wanted to be remembered for himself
The prophets and apostles summon us to an understanding of this reality
The human heart is... beyond self-help
Our condition was hopeless, but now it is taken up into Christ’s divine life

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the total lack of human 'Pouvoir' (ability) and the divine endowment of a new 'Pouvoir' through the New Covenant.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'Stone Wall' (S2) to the impossibility of self-help (~S2), then to the unilateral divine action of the New Covenant (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through the 'transaction of unimaginable grace' in the Cross of Christ.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the 'desperately corrupt' heart is the pivot of the sermon.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies a 'Heavy Opponent' (Sin/Death) that the human Subject cannot overcome, necessitating a Subject-switch to God.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: He kept heroically to his calling.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Here is the great action that the Lord is preparing to redeem his creation.
The human heart is desperately corrupt and beyond self-help.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jeremiah is presented as a 'God-intoxicated' sufferer, but the sermon explicitly states he is not the point; God's action is.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Jeremiah (partially as a sufferer, but mostly as a pointer to God)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Jeremiah's words come true in Christ's actions.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment through external rescue.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation leading to grateful obedience.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Human Dilemma' to the 'Divine Solution' is structurally perfect.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: in his death on our behalf and in our place

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment (Writing the law on the heart)

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The current balance correctly subordinates Devoir to Pouvoir.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics, moving from a radical diagnosis of the human condition to a unilateral divine solution in Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the pathos of the celebrity examples, Greimassian analysis reveals these are actantial 'Opponents' illustrating human inability.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Jeremiah's context; semiotics shows how the 'New Covenant' functions as a modal transformation of the Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-switch'—where the hearer stops trying to be the Subject of their own healing and becomes the Receiver of God's action.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (watches, builds, plants, makes, puts, writes, searches, tries)
We (share, surround, are involved, go along)
appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's grammar of grace almost perfectly.
